intro: Phlox dolichantha var. bernardina, commonly known as Bernard's phlox, is a perennial flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. It produces erect, branched stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and natural landscapes.
